means: （把门等）从铰链上取下( unhinge的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The stress of war temporarily unhinged him.
sentence.Network_cn: 战争的压力让他一时丧失了神志。

sentence.Network_en: He was unhinged by his wife's death.
sentence.Network_cn: 他妻子去世使他精神错乱.

sentence.Network_en: The phrase "yeah yeah yeah" can rarely have been delivered with so much unhinged passion.
sentence.Network_cn: “好耶！好耶！好耶！”的呼叫声极少带有如此狂放的激情。

list.abs: 英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(U1)|无忧教育 ... unhesitatingly 不踌躇地 unhinge 拉开 unhitch 放松.
GRE 同义词总结大全 ... zealot n． 狂热份子，热心者 | unhinge v 使发狂，使错乱 barricade v.n. 设栅阻挡,栅栏 |.

entry.def: If you describe someone's behaviour or performance as unhinged, you are critical of it because it seems wild and uncontrollable.

example.ex: The phrase 'yeah yeah yeah' can rarely have been delivered with so much unhinged passion.
example.tran: “好耶！好耶！好耶！”的呼叫声极少带有如此狂放的激情。

auth_sentence.content: It's got to be celebratory, euphoric, unhinged.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's got to be celebratory, euphoric, unhinged.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's got to be celebratory, euphoric, unhinged.

auth_sentence.content: It unhinged Williams, and it unhinged Kushner.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It unhinged Williams, and it unhinged Kushner.

auth_sentence.content: She looked even more unhinged than usual.
auth_sentence.res_content: She looked even more unhinged than usual.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She looked even more unhinged than usual.
